intro: Tithymalus gedrosiacus, commonly known as the Gedrosian tithymalus, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its blooming period occurs during the brief summer months, and it plays a minor role in local ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
